sub_title: Understanding Human-Nature interaction by using Agent-Based Modelling--Uncovering spatial patterns and processes using GIS--Shaping a more sustainable and inclusive future for both our urban and rural landscapes
summary:
-- Researcher & Lecturer, Geografie, Planologie en Internationale Ontwikkelingsstudies, Universiteit van Amsterdam (Since Jan 2023) | CLIFF
-- Lecturer, Geografie, Planologie en Internationale Ontwikkelingsstudies, Universiteit van Amsterdam (Since Sep 2022)
-- University Teaching Qualification (BKO/UTQ): certified on 8 June 2022, by 4TU (TU Delft, TU/e, UT, and WUR)
-- Postdoc researcher at University of Twente: SECBIVIT-Scenarios for providing multiple ecosystem services and biodiversity in viticultural landscapes (2019-2022).
-- Research consulting for the World Bank: Urbanization processes in Sudan, future urban growth modelling, and exposure to flood risks, at the national level and selected example Sudanese cities (2022). 
-- Postdoc fellow at Robert-Bosch Postdoc Academy for Transformational Leadership 2020-2022.
-- Lecturer in MSc level Elective course Land Change Modelling (2019, 2020, 2021), using Spatial Logistic Regression, Cellular Automata, and Agent-Based Modelling; Supervisor in MSc level introduction course on GIS, RS, and Data integration (2019, 2021); MSc thesis supervisor (2019-2020); University of Twente.
-- PhD researcher Exploring the effects of feedbacks in land systems - A complex adaptive systems approach, at Wageningen University & Research (2013-2018). 
-- Intern Industry Solutions, ESRI, Redlands, California, USA (2012-2013)
-- MSc Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation, Track Urban Planning and Management, Cum Laude (2010-2012)
--President of Class, School of Geography, Beijing Normal University, China (2006-2010)
--Chinese Goodwill Ambassador to Thailand - for the 30th Anniversary of diplomatic relations between China and Thailand (2005).

awards.title: St. Gallen Wings of Excellence Award 2012
awards.description: With my contribution to the 42nd St. Gallen Symposium on the topic of "Facing Risk", I won the award through the essay competition. Titled as one of the "Leader of Tomorrow", I had programs with various industries and fellow LoTs concerning the risk, from the perspective of social/political, economic, and environmental. Programs with SwissRe, Accenture, Greenpeace International, etc. My own contribution was from the environment perspective and it was valued as one of the top 50 contributions for the year of 2012. A summary could be found at St. Gallen Symposium website.

awards.title: Master of Science, Cum Laude
awards.description: With an average grade of 84 (MSc thesis graded 85), I received my MSc degree Cum Laude at ITC, University of Twente on 2nd March 2012.
awards.issuer: Faculty of ITC, University of Twente

awards.description: As the Chairperson of the 3rd National Model United Nations Conference, at the Planery Sessions, Yang Chen was awarded as one of the three Chairperson Awards by UNA-China,in collaboration with Australian Human Rights Council as the two sponsors of the 3rd National MUN Conference.
awards.issuer: China United Nations Association, Human Rights Council Australia

projects.title: Postdoc Academy for Transformational Leadership
projects.description: The Postdoc Academy for Transformational Leadership is an initiative of the Robert Bosch Stiftung and a joint project of the Robert Bosch Stiftung and the four academic centres Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin, Leuphana University of Lüneburg, the Stockholm Resilience Centre and the Dutch Research Institute for Transitions (DRIFT) in Rotterdam. It provides an intensive high-end training with four seminars in two years that broaden the research competencies of postdocs and promote their qualifications towards transdisciplinary leadership. The program also offers seed funding (e.g. for stakeholder meetings or proposal writing activities) to small groups of participants, who plan to initiate research collaborations. Furthermore, an active network of current and former participants of the program will be established.

projects.title: SECBIVIT
projects.description:
Scenarios for providing multiple ecosystem services and biodiversity in viticultural landscapes
The SECBIVIT project will investigate the effects of inter-row management and pest control intensity within landscapes differing in structural diversity on biodiversity conservation and ecosystem service provision. The consortium will develop spatially explicit agent-based models on the social-ecological system for viticulture. These models describe winegrowers as agents who take farming decisions and thereby influence the vineyard and surrounding landscape in various European viticultural regions from Spain to Romania.  The aim is to model the effects on biodiversity and ecosystem services to determine optimal land use strategies in viticultural landscapes.

contributors.headline: Understanding Human-Nature interaction by using Agent-Based Modelling--Uncovering spatial patterns and processes using GIS--Shaping a more sustainable and inclusive future for both our urban and rural landscapes

profile_positions.description: I worked on the research project titled "Regime Shifts and Tipping Points of Land Use Systems" under the Wageningen University IPOP project of Complex Adaptive Systems.  For this project, I explored the effects of feedbacks on land system behaviour. I used agent-based modelling and took a explanatory and explorative aproach to understand how feedback mechanisms affect  nonlinearity, hysteresis, and resilience of (agricultural) land systems.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.description: Interning at industry solutions under the supervision of Chris Thomas and Shannon McElvaney was great fun. They gave me the maximum flexibility to explore what I like about the products of esri related to urban planning and management. Durting this time, I got to know products such as CityEngine, BusinessAnalyst, CommunityAnalyst, ArcGIS online, etc and developed tutorials for potential customers. Anther great experience with Shannon is Geodesign. I participated in the Geodesign Summit 2013 and witnessed the spread of such concept and practice in Asia and Europe. When Chris and Shannon knew that I wanted to go back to school (Europe) for research, they were willing to help me and provide whatever I needed to make it possible. I like and miss my days in sunny Southern California.
